pullRequest.body:
Also revert some `scoped` modifiers on `simp`s.

---

Waiting for a benchmark.

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#9725~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#9724~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Should this be written in terms of `VAdd` instead? Then you could show that all affine equivalences are `VAddConstEquiv`s

@eric-wieser The only application I have in mind is a lift of a circle map/homeomorphism to the real line. Do you have some applications of `VAdd` version in mind? I mean, some nontrivial result that will benefit from this generalization. If no, then I would prefer to postpone this generalization until we need it.

### PR summary [f0f2b2adaa](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9726/commits/f0f2b2adaa3a343837415cc41a87f0d0e72387bb)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.AddConstMap.Equiv`|578|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AddConstEquiv`
`+ Simps.symm_apply`
`+ coe_toEquiv`
`+ equivUnits`
`+ ext`
`+ instDiv`
`+ instGroup`
`+ instInv`
`+ instMul`
`+ instOne`
`+ instPowInt`
`+ instPowNat`
`+ refl`
`+ refl_trans`
`+ self_trans_symm`
`+ symm`
`+ symm_refl`
`+ symm_symm`
`+ symm_trans_self`
`+ toAddConstMapHom`
`+ toEnd`
`+ toEquiv_inj`
`+ toEquiv_injective`
`+ toPerm`
`+ trans`
`+ trans_refl`
`++ instance {G H : Type*} [Add G] [Add H] {a : G} {b : H} :`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/68aaf3a5-4200-4130-9ab5-e4fd020e606c) for commit d345bdf8beb24ee14049f12811c2ad279f0c718f.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/c0777691-8347-403e-981e-b2b1877cb38f/to/68aaf3a5-4200-4130-9ab5-e4fd020e606c) against commit 03cf1129cb3dc60979585c23d29728cb6393e95c.

Let's see whether it now works from my phone

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10000483812/job/27642799900)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10000483812/job/27642799769)

```suggestion
/-- Interpret an `AddConstEquiv` as an `AddConstMap`. -/
```
should this not be done by some general `EquivLike` plumbing?
I see that other `*Equiv` prove `toEquiv_injective` first, then use it for `EquivLike`. I changed this file to follow the same pattern. We may change it everywhere later.

Can this also be
```suggestion
@[simp, norm_cast] theorem coe_mk (f : G → H) (hf) : ⇑(mk f hf : G →+c[a, b] H) = f := rfl
```
while you're at it?

```suggestion
@[simp, norm_cast]
theorem coe_vadd {K : Type*} [VAdd K H] [VAddAssocClass K H H] (c : K) (f : G →+c[a, b] H) :
```
etc

```suggestion
lemma toEquiv_inj {e₁ e₂ : G ≃+c[a, b] H} : e₁.toEquiv = e₂.toEquiv ↔ e₁ = e₂ :=
```

```suggestion
@[simp, norm_cast] theorem coe_mul (f g : G →+c[a, a] G) : ⇑(f * g) = f ∘ g := rfl
```
Will it `norm_cast` RHS to LHS? I prefer to `norm_cast` it to `.comp`. Do we have "`push_cast` but no `norm_cast`" lemmas?
Yes that's one of the settings to norm_cast, although I don't remember how  it's called so you'll need to look through the docs
There is a `push_cast` simp attribute. Added.

```suggestion
@[simp, norm_cast] theorem coe_one : ⇑(1 : G →+c[a, a] G) = id := rfl
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: define `AddConstEquiv`
